metadata.session: FIRST SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    how many community schools:
(i)    there were in Zambia as of February, 2012; and (ii)    had been taken over by the Government from January, 2010 to January, 2012; and
(b)    how many community school teachers had been trained with the help of the Government from 2006 to 2011 and were later absorbed in the Ministry on permanent and pensionable terms.

questions.minister: Vice President why the boundary between Mpulungu and Nsama Districts in the Northern Province does not follow the Lufubu River.

parts: (a)    why the Primary Health Posts (PHPs) which were very effective in service delivery in rural areas were abandoned; and
(b)    when the PHPs will be revived especially in Kalabo.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when Demu Basic School will be rehabilitated and upgraded to high school level;
(b)    when Simudima and Chilundu Basic Schools will be rehabilitated; and
(c)    whether the Ministry is aware that Kazungula and Chimowa Community Schools in Pemba have no staff houses and, if so, when staff houses will be constructed.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    how many fuel storage tanks are being constructed country-wide;
(b)    what the total cost of the construction of the storage tanks is; and
(c)    what the economic benefit of putting up the tanks is.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    when Old Ndeke Market in Bupe Ward in Kamfinsa Parliamentary Constituency will be opened to the public; and
(b)    whether the Government has any plans to construct modern infrastructure at the following locations:
(i)    Ndeke Market in Ndeke Ward; and (ii)    Kamfinsa Market in Kamfinsa Ward.
(a)    when the Government will construct staff houses and office blocks for police posts at the following areas:
(i)    Sioma; and (ii)    Natukoma; and
(b)    when the Government will officially open Mutomena Police Post in Shangombo District since accommodation is available.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    when the Government entered into an agreement with the World Bank for the execution of the increased access to electricity supply project;
(b)    what the key components of the project and the targeted beneficiaries are; and
(c)    what the duration of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Health whether the Government is aware that untrained personnel attend to patients at Hamuleya Rural Health Centre in Pemba and, if so, what immediate measures the Ministry intends to take to address the situation.
parts: (a)    what the total number of registered voters in the country in the following years was:
(b)    of the registered voters, what percentage actually voted in each election year;
(c)    what the total number of spoiled ballot papers in each year was;
(d)    what the total number of women who contested in the elections in 1991, 1996, 2001, 2006 and 2011 was at the following levels:
(i)    Ward; (ii)    Parliamentary; and (iii)    Presidential;
(e)    how many local and international organisations observed the elections in Zambia in the same period as at (d) by name; and

(f)    whether any journalists were attacked by political party cadres from 2006 to 2011, year by year and, if so, how many journalists were attacked. W37    Mr Chisala (Chilubi) - to ask the Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry what the objectives of the following arrangements are:
(a)    Zambia-Malawi-Mozambique Growth Triangle;
(b)    Investment Promotion and Protection Agreements; and

(c)    Triangle of Hope Initiative.
